result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Wayne Kinlow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all mandatory court costs and DNA surcharges, fees by 02-23-2018, ALSO 25% of prison wages to be used towards the mandatory costs through the Department of Corrections, or if not paid, civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.
Defendant to provide DNA sample.

***Court set restitution at zero***

With credit for 5 days.
Consecutive to: Case 15CF1042 AND ALL OTHERS/ANY OTHER SENTENCE.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Wayne Kinlow

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Court set restitution at zero. 

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve SIX MONTHS  in the House of Correction, consecutive to  15CF1042 AND ALL OTHERS any other sentence with credit for 5 days time served.

Court ordered defendant to pay all mandatory  court costs and  DNA surcharges, fees  by 2-23-18 , also 25% of prison wages to be used towards the mandatory costs through the department of corrections or, if not paid, civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant. Defendant to provide DNA sample.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Michael Wayne Kinlow in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Michael Wayne Kinlow in custody.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties in receipt of doctor's report. No corrections or additions. All parties stipulate to the findings that the defendant is competent to proceed.

Defendant Michael Wayne Kinlow in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Michael Wayne Kinlow in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant has been produced.  Statements heard.    Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.  Court ordered defendant remains REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Case adjourned for return on doctor's report in Br. 47.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for February 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub in court, defendant Michael Wayne Kinlow not in court, in custody.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defense wishes tor raise competency.  Court ordered defendant produced.

Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Pick N Save, 5700 W Capitol Drive, Milwaukee,WI

Defendant Michael Wayne Kinlow in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Michael Wayne Kinlow in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT. LR

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT. LR

Defendant Michael Wayne Kinlow in court with attorney Kathryn A Holtz.  Defendant Michael Wayne Kinlow in custody.  Gary D. Mahkorn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) gj
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT. lr

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT. lr
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Pick N Save located at 5700 W. Capitol Drive, Milwaukee, WI.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michael Wayne Kinlow in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Michael Wayne Kinlow in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
